results.title: Jay Jays: Cas
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This short advertisement is publicising a casual clothing company, “Jay-Jays” and its range of beach/bathing clothing modellled by young girls and guys.

results.title: The City of lost children [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro, Claudie Ossard, France 3 Cinema, Studio Canal+ and Lumière
results.brief_description: An extraordinary film from the makers of “Delicatessen”. Krank lives on a lonely oil rig in a swirling sea. He cannot dream and is aging prematurely so he kidnaps young children hoping to steal their sleeping thoughts. On a quest to find his young brother, a fairground strongman called One sets off on a series of fantastical adventures to rescue the lost children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro, Claudie Ossard, France 3 Cinema, Studio Canal+ and Lumière

results.title: Arctic jungle
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
The life of the Eskimo is a constant struggle for existence against the harshness of the Arctic environment. The film shows spear fishing, making lamp fuel, manufacturing clothing and kayaks, and hunting powerful quarry like the polar bear and white whale.

results.title: Gold
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A description of placer gold mining in the Yukon. East of Dawson City giant dredges cut deep into the creek beds, leaving behind monstrous coils of waste as the gold-bearing gravel is washed. The film shows how gold is trapped and hand-sorted, finally to emerge as precious gold brick.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: What's on Your Mind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
Roughly contemporaneous with Hitchcock’s Spellbound, this NFB informational film is a survey of what was then the cutting edge of progressive psychiatry. Reflecting the new enthusiasm for pop-Freudianism in a North America seeking respite for it’s traumatised World War II veterans. Although punctuated by some lighter moments, the melodramatic music scoring reflects the film’s emotional tone. Although prone to many of the social prejudices of its day (witness gender politics), this film also provides an illuminating account of pioneering forms of psychodrama and child psychiatry.

results.title: Monster madness
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Two characters find themselves caught and surrounded by an underworld of magic and eventually get blown out of that strange environment.
